docs.summary: Manage schedules & session

params.name: sessionId
params.doc: Optional. If this field is given, the participant will be added to this specific session.

docs.summary:
Adds a participant to a schedule or to a specific session.  
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

extra.description: Adds a participant to a schedule.
Adds a participant to a session.

params.name: preserveFutureSessionsWithParticipants
params.doc: Whether to preserve future sessions with reservations. Defaults to false.

params.name: from
params.doc: Time to cancel the sessions from. Optional. If this field is empty, all of this schedule's sessions will be canceled.

params.name: participantNotification
params.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change, and an optional custom message.

docs.summary:
Cancels a schedule. Equivalent to batch cancel of sessions linked to a single schedule.  
The schedule changes to status = CANCELED -  all sessions up until the time of cancellation are kept, and all future sessions are removed.  
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

extra.description: Cancel a schedule without notifying participants

examples.title: Cancel Schedule.

extra.description: Cancel a schedule with a custom notification to participants

docs.summary:
Creates a schedule.
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

extra.description: Create a schedule with recurring intervals.
Create a schedule with availability

examples.title: Create an availability based schedule.

extra.description: Create a schedule for private appointments

params.name: deleted
params.doc: Session fields to revert to empty, in order to revert to the data inherited from the schedule.

docs.summary:
Creates a session (adds a session to a schedule).  
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

extra.description: Create a session on a a given schedule.

params.name: participantNotification
params.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change, and an optional custom message.

docs.summary:
Deletes a session from a schedule.  
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

examples.title: Delete Session

extra.description: Deletes a session

docs.summary:
Returns a schedule from the calendar.  
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Read Bookings Calendar or the Manage Bookings permissions scope.  
> With the Read Bookings Calendar permission scope, the schedule participants are not returned.

extra.description: Requests a schedule by its Id

docs.summary:
Returns a session from the calendar.  
> **Permissions**   
> This endpoint requires the Read Bookings Calendar or the Manage Bookings permission scope.  
> With the Read Bookings Calendar permission scope, the session participants are not returned.

extra.description: Requests a session by its Id

params.name: dontIncludeScheduleParticipants
params.doc: Whether to return a list of the schedule's participants.

docs.summary:
Lists schedules by schedule IDs or schedule owner IDs.
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Read Bookings Calendar or the Manage Bookings  permission scope.  
> With the Read Bookings Calendar permission scope, the schedule participants are not returned.

extra.description: Returns all the schedules in the site

params.name: fieldMask
params.doc: Field mask of fields to return. Currently only supports the "scheduleOwnerId" field.

docs.summary:
Returns multiple sessions from the calendar.
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Read Bookings Calendar or the Manage Bookings permission scope
> With the Read Bookings Calendar permission scope, the sessions return without participants.

extra.description: Currently, only the 'scheduleOwnerId' field is supported.
Returns all the sessions by the requested Ids.

docs.summary:
Removes a participant from a schedule or from a specific session.  
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

extra.description: Removes a participant

params.name: splitTimes
params.doc: A list of times where the interval is to be split. Must not be in the past. Must not contain duplicate times.

docs.summary:
Splits an existing interval into two or more parts.
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

extra.description: Split an existing interval into two parts.

params.name: participantNotification
params.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change, and an optional custom message.

docs.summary:
Updates an existing recurring interval.
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

params.name: participant
params.doc: Participant to update, identified by the ID field.

params.name: fieldMask
params.doc: Field mask of fields to update.

docs.summary:
Updates participant details.  
 The field values you specify replace the existing values. Fields that you donâ€™t specify in the request remain unchanged.  
Array fields, if specified, overwrite the existing arrays; this discards any previous array elements.  
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

extra.description: Updates a participant's phone number.

params.name: fieldMask
params.doc: Field mask of fields to update.

params.name: alignTimeExceptions
params.doc: Optional. Defaults to false. In case of updated intervals' start time, this field indicates whether to align those interval's time exceptions.

params.name: participantNotification
params.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change, and an optional custom message.

docs.summary:
Updates a schedule.  
This method supports patch semantics. The field values you specify replace the existing values.  
Fields that you donâ€™t specify in the request remain unchanged.  
 Array fields, if specified, overwrite the existing arrays; this discards any previous array elements.
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

extra.description: Patch update the capacity of a schedule.
Updates an interval of a schedule.

params.name: session.id
params.doc: Identifier for this session when session is a single session or generated from recurring interval. Optional.

params.name: updated
params.doc: Field mask of fields to update.

params.name: participantNotification
params.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change, and an optional custom message.

params.name: deleted
params.doc: Session fields to revert to empty, in order to revert to the data inherited from the schedule.

docs.summary:
Updates a session.  
The field values you specify replace the existing values. Fields that you donâ€™t specify in the request remain unchanged.  
 Array fields, if specified, overwrite the existing arrays; this discards any previous array elements.  
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Manage Bookings permissions scope

extra.description: Update the start & end times of a session using the "updated" field mask.
Update a session's rate, result session inherits the rate from the schedule's rate.

members.name: amount
members.doc: The price amount

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency

members.name: downPayAmount
members.doc: Optional. Represents a required down payment as part of the transaction process.

messages.name: labeledPriceOptionsMapEntry
messages.displayName: labeled Price Options Map Entry Object

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs.Mapping between a named price option and the Price itself.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type ref

members.name: labeledPriceOptions
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs.Mapping between a named price option and the Price itself.

members.name: priceText
members.doc: User defined textual price. Optional.

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of the registered participant (optional).

members.name: email
members.doc: Email address of the contact (optional).

members.name: id
members.doc: Reservation ID. Required.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID (optional).

members.name: partySize
members.doc: Party size (optional). Defaults to 0. Min value is 0, max value is 250.

members.name: approvalStatus
members.doc: Approval status for the participant. Defaults to UNDEFINED.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Phone number of the contact (optional).

members.name: repetition
members.doc: The frequency of the recurrence in weeks. i.e. when this value is 4, the interval occurs every 4 weeks. Optional. The default is 1. minimum: 1, maximum: 52.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule Identifier.

members.name: transparency
members.doc: Indicates if the schedule is available during the session. Possible values are: FREE - the schedule is available during the session. BUSY - schedule are not available during the session, this is the default value.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: The linked schedule owner id. Read only. Derived from the schedule_id.

members.name: daysOfWeek
members.doc: The day the interval accrue. Optional. The default is the day of the recurring interval's start time.

members.name: hourOfDay
members.doc: The hour of the day the interval accrue. must be consistent with the Interval start time. Options. The default is 0. minimum: 0, maximum: 23.

members.name: minuteOfHour
members.doc: The minutes of hour the interval accrue. must be consistent with the Interval end time. Options. The default is 0. minimum: 0, maximum: 59.

members.name: duration
members.doc: The duration of the interval in minutes. Required. Part of the session end time calculation. minimum: 1, maximum: 86400.

members.name: affectedSchedules
members.doc: Specifies the list of linked schedules and the way this link affects the corresponding schedules' availability. Can be calculated from the schedule or overridden on the recurring interval.

members.name: interval
members.doc: The interval rules. The day, hour and minutes the interval is recurring.

members.name: id
members.doc: The recurring interval identifier.

members.name: intervalType
members.doc: The type of recurring interval.

members.name: end
members.doc: The end time of the recurring interval. Optional. Empty value indicates that there is no end time.

members.name: frequency
members.doc: The frequency of the interval. Optional. The default is frequency with the default repetition.

members.name: start
members.doc: The start time of the recurring interval. Required.

members.name: title
members.doc: Optional. When provided this value will be used in the synced title of the external calendar event. Default is Session.title

members.name: description
members.doc: Optional. When provided this value will be used in the synced description of the external calendar event.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc:
The time in seconds of UTC time since Unix epoch. Optional.
Required if the localDateTime field is not specified.
If the local date time is given then this field will be ignored and will be calculated from
the local date time and the business timezone.

members.name: localDateTime
members.doc:
The time in local date time. Optional.
If the this field is specified then the timestamp will be ignored and will be calculated from
this local date time and the business timezone.

members.name: timeZone
members.doc: The time zone. Optional.

members.name: providerId
members.doc: Conferencing provider ID

members.name: externalId
members.doc: The conference meeting ID in the provider's conferencing system

members.name: hostUrl
members.doc: URL used by the host to start the conference meeting

members.name: providerId
members.doc: The provider Id

members.name: id
members.doc: The conference meeting ID (In WiX Calendar)

members.name: guestUrl
members.doc: URL used by a guest to join the conference meeting

members.name: password
members.doc: Password to join the conference.

members.name: address
members.doc: The address as set by the owner. Valid only when location_type is OWNER_CUSTOM.

members.name: rate
members.doc: The price options offered to participate this session. Optional. The default value is the schedule rate.

members.name: location
members.doc:
Geographic location of the session as free-form text. Optional.
The default value is the location in the schedule.

members.name: calendarConference
members.doc: Holding the conference meeting created when the session is created, according to the details set in the Schedule's conference provider information.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: The schedule owner id. Read only. Derived from the schedule_id.

members.name: tags
members.doc: Tags of the session. Optional. The default value is the tags in the schedule.

members.name: participants
members.doc:
The registered participants of this session. Read only.
Can be added using Schedules service using the Participants apis.

members.name: affectedSchedules
members.doc:
Specifies the list of linked schedules and the way this link affects the corresponding schedules' availability.
Can be calculated from the schedule intervals or overridden on the Session.
Currently supported only for 1 schedule.

members.name: originalStart
members.doc: The original start time of the session in the result. Optional.

members.name: id
members.doc: Identifier for this session when session is a single session or generated from recurring interval. Optional.

members.name: inheritedFields
members.doc: A list of fields for which values were inherited from the schedule.

members.name: recurringIntervalId
members.doc:
Recurring interval id. Read only. Optional.
Specified when the session was originally generated from schedule recurring interval.

members.name: timeReservedAfter
members.doc:
Time reserved after session end time. Read only.
Derived from the schedule availability constraints time between slots.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Status of the session. Optional. Possible values are: CONFIRMED, this is the default value.
CANCELLED, if this session was generated from recurring interval and then got deleted, or if it was created as a single session and then was deleted.

members.name: totalNumberOfParticipants
members.doc:
The current number of registered participants on this session. Read only.
Calculated by the number of participants plus the additional participants.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc:
Schedule identifier. The schedule of the session. Required.
Session must be under specific schedule.

members.name: end
members.doc:
The end time of the session. Required.
The end time must be after the start time and with the same calendar date time field.

members.name: externalCalendarOverrides
members.doc:
Optional. When provided, the values will be used to override default fields values which are synced to external calendar.
Read more in external calendar documentation. The default is the schedule external calendar overrides.

members.name: notes
members.doc:
The note of the session. Indicating additional information about the session. Optional.
The default is empty notes.

members.name: title
members.doc: The textual title of the session, i.e. A service name. Optional. The default value is the title in the schedule.

members.name: type
members.doc:
The type of the session.
Can be event or working hours session that represent available time of the schedule owner.
The default is event.

members.name: start
members.doc: The start time of the session. Required.

members.name: capacity
members.doc:
The maximum number of participants that can be added to the session. Optional.
The default value is the capacity in the schedule.

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change

members.name: message
members.doc: message to send to the participants, optional

docs.summary: Availability policy applied to all site schedules.

members.name: splitInterval
members.doc: Specify how to split the schedule slots in intervals of minutes.

docs.summary: Indicates the time between available slots' start time. e.g., from 5 minute slots (3:00, 3:05, 3:15) and 1 hour slots (3:00, 4:00, 5:00).

members.name: sameAsDuration
members.doc:
Required. Indicates where the value for schedules split interval is specifies.
In case this field is true, the value will be the sum of the first duration in
schedule.availabilityConstraints.SlotDurations field and schedule.availabilityConstraints.TimeBetweenSlots field.

members.name: valueInMinutes
members.doc:
Required in case the same_as_duration field is false.
Optional in case the same_as_duration field is true.

docs.summary:
Schedule's availability calculation is executed by the schedule's available intervals and this additional information.
Schedule's available intervals are recurring intervals (defined in the schedule) minus sessions that has no more spots for bookings (including time between_slots), or schedule's sessions with open spots for bookings.

members.name: start
members.doc: The time the schedule starts to be available for booking. Required.

members.name: end
members.doc: The time schedule stops to be available for booking. Optional. Empty value indicates that there is no end time.

members.name: linkedSchedules
members.doc:
Reference to other schedules for availability calculations. Optional.
Supported only when there are no recurring intervals and with availability calculation constraints.

members.name: constraints
members.doc:
Additional constraints for calculating the schedule's availability for booking. Optional.
Describes how to calculate the specific slots that are available for booking.

docs.summary: Describes how to calculate the specific slots that are available for booking.

members.name: slotDurations
members.doc:
The optional durations of the available slots in minutes. Required. Minimum: 1.
Calculation of the available slots will generate slots with these durations if are not produce a conflict with the available intervals.

members.name: timeBetweenSlots
members.doc:
The time between slots in minutes.
If a slot has already booked, then the start time of the next available slot will be calculated by the booked slot's end time plus the time_between_slots value.
Minimum: 0. Maximum: 120.

members.name: splitInterval
members.doc:
Specify how to split the slots in intervals of minutes.
This value indicates the time between available slots' start time. e.g., from 5 minute slots (3:00, 3:05, 3:15) and 1 hour slots (3:00, 4:00, 5:00).
Optional. The default is the first duration in slot_durations field.
Deprecated. please use the split_slots_interval.value_in_minutes.

members.name: slotsSplitInterval
members.doc:
Specify how to split the slots in intervals of minutes.
This value indicates the time between available slots' start time. e.g., from 5 minute slots (3:00, 3:05, 3:15) and 1 hour slots (3:00, 4:00, 5:00).

members.name: rate
members.doc: The price options offered to book this schedule's slots. Optional. The default is no rate.

members.name: location
members.doc:
Geographic location of the session as free-form text. Optional.
This is the default location of the schedule's sessions.

members.name: calendarConference
members.doc: A conference meeting created for the schedule. This is used when a participant is added to a schedule.

members.name: firstSessionStart
members.doc: The start time of the schedule. Read only. calculated by the start time of the first session.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: The id of the schedule's owner. e.g, in case of schedule of a service, service id.

members.name: intervals
members.doc:
Specifies the intervals for the sessions calculation. Optional. e.g. when creating class service you can add
pattern for recurring intervals, these intervals can be returned as schedule's sessions or available slots if
there are no other availability calculation constraints and the capacity is bigger then the current total number
of sessions' participants.

members.name: tags
members.doc:
Tags of the schedule. Optional. e.g., tag as service type. Google sessions tag as "Google".
This is the default tags of the schedule's sessions.

members.name: participants
members.doc:
The registered participants of this schedule. Read only.
Can be added using Schedules service using the Participants apis.

members.name: availability
members.doc:
Describes how to calculate the schedule's availability for adding participants. Optional.
Empty value indicates that this schedule is not available for adding participants.
This definition will be applied to the schedule's available intervals. Schedule's available intervals are the
recurring intervals minus sessions that has no more spots, or schedule's sessions with open spots.

members.name: lastSessionEnd
members.doc: The end time of the schedule. Read only. calculated by the end time of the last session.

members.name: version
members.doc: the schedule's version

members.name: id
members.doc: Schedule identifier.

members.name: updated
members.doc: The time when this schedule was last modified.

members.name: inheritedFields
members.doc: A list of fields for which values were inherited from the business.

members.name: status
members.doc:
The schedule's status. Optional.
Possible values are: CREATED, This is the default status. CANCELLED, the schedule was cancelled.

members.name: totalNumberOfParticipants
members.doc:
The current number of registered participants on this schedule when this schedule is a bookable slot. Read only.
calculated by the number of participants plus the additional participants.

members.name: conferenceProvider
members.doc: Conferencing Provider. A schedule with a conferencing provider will use to provider information to create a conference meeting on the provider's system when a session is created on the schedule or on one of its linked schedule's.

members.name: externalCalendarOverrides
members.doc:
Optional.
When provided, the values will be used to override default fields values which are synced to external calendar.
Read more in external calendar documentation.

members.name: title
members.doc:
The textual title of the schedule. Optional.
This is the default title of the schedule's sessions. i.e., a service name. Max length: 6000.

members.name: timeZone
members.doc: The time zone of the schedule. Optional.

members.name: created
members.doc: The time when this schedule was created.

members.name: capacity
members.doc:
The maximum number of participants that can be added to this schedule's slots. Optional.
The default is 1. This is the default capacity of the schedule's sessions. minimum: 1, maximum: 1000

extra.description: Availability policy updated.
Schedule created.

examples.title: Session created notification

extra.description: Session created.

examples.title: Session updaed notification

extra.description: Session updaed.

examples.title: Session canceled notification

extra.description: Session canceled.
Schedule canceled.

examples.title: Schedule updated notification

extra.description: Schedule updated.

members.doc: Whether to notify participants about changed sessions. deprecated, use participant_notification

members.name: siteProperties
members.doc: site properties. Optional. Given in create schedule notification.

members.name: migrationEvent
members.doc: supported only for schedule migration apis.

members.name: multipleSessionsCreated
members.doc: supported only for schedule migration apis.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

The given schedules move to a CANCELLED status which means that all sessions up until
the cancellation point in time are kept, while removing all following sessions.

docs.summary: schedule owner

members.name: uid
members.doc: The wix user id. Required.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: Schedule owner id assigned to the user id. e.g, in case of schedule of a staff member, can be staff member id.

members.name: msId
members.doc: The meta site id related to this schedule owner id. Required.

messages.name: _com_wix_bookings_schedules_api_v1_AssignWiXUserAsScheduleOwnerResponse
messages.displayName: Assign Wi X User As Schedule Owner Response Object

members.name: uid
members.doc: The wix user id related to this schedule owner id. Required.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: Schedule owner id. e.g, in case of schedule of a staff member, can be staff member id.

docs.summary: schedule owner

members.name: uid
members.doc: The wix user id. Required.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: Schedule owner id. e.g, in case of schedule of a staff member, can be staff member id.

members.name: msId
members.doc: The meta site id related to this schedule owner id. Required.

messages.name: _com_wix_bookings_schedules_api_v1_UnAssignWiXUserFromScheduleOwnerResponse
messages.displayName: Un Assign Wi X User From Schedule Owner Response Object

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: Schedule owner id. e.g, in case of schedule of a staff member, can be staff member id.

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • PENDING
  • APPROVED
  • DECLINED

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • FREE - Indicates the schedule is available.
  • BUSY - Indicates the schedule is not available. Default value.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED - Undefined.
  • MON - Monday.
  • TUE - Tuesday.
  • WED - Wednesday.
  • THU - Thursday.
  • FRI - Friday.
  • SAT - Saturday.
  • SUN - Sunday.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED - The default value. Sessions for this interval will be of type EVENT.
  • EVENT - A recurring interval of events
  • TIME_AVAILABILITY - Deprecated
  • AVAILABILITY - A recurring interval for availability

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • EVENT - The session type is event. Represents a calendar event of this session schedule owner. This is the default type.
  • WORKING_HOURS - Deprecated. The session type is working hours. Represents intervals that masked as working hours in the schedule owner schedule.
  • TIME_AVAILABILITY - Deprecated
  • AVAILABILITY - A new type for replacing WORKING_HOURS.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • OWNER_BUSINESS - The address is determined by the business address as set by the owner in the siteâ€™s general settings.
  • OWNER_CUSTOM - The address is determined by the owner.
  • CUSTOM - The address is determined and managed elsewhere

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • CONFIRMED - The session is confirmed. This is the default status.
  • CANCELLED - The session is cancelled (deleted). Can be cancelled exceptions of a recurring interval indicate that this session should no longer be presented, or can be deleted single session. The ListSessions returns cancelled sessions only if 'includeDelete' flag is set to true.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • CREATED
  • CANCELLED
